results.title: The Wolves of Willoughby Chase
results.brief_description: England in 1832 is a dark and dangerous place. Ravenous wolves prowl the grounds of Willoughby Chase, but the lovely daughter of the owners, Bonnie, and her cousin, Sylvia, are kept safe by trusted and faithful servants. When Bonnie’s parents set off to travel, Bonnie is left in charge of a new governess, Miss Slighcarp. Bonnie and Sylvia are transported to an orphanage and the greedy, evil Miss Slighcarp takes over the manor. She sacks the loyal servants and begins a reign of terror, helped in part by her strange power over the wolves - but Bonnie and Sylvia resolve to fight her evil powers. Stars Mel Smith.

results.title: The Wolf
results.creator_credit: Beverly Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was Beverly Bailey’s husband who suggested she take the trip to England and Canada to meet his family. As Bailey disappeared through the airport door her husband wondered if he’d said the wrong thing.

results.title: The Wog boy
results.creator_credit: Aleksi Vellis, Nick Giannopoulos, John Brousek, Cinemedia and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Steve (Nick Giannopoulos) is an unemployed Greek man who becomes an unwitting scape goat for various political interest groups when he gets branded a dole cheat on a tabloid style current affairs program. His cause gets taken up by the Minister of employment Raelene Beagle- Thorpe (Geraldine Turner), who turns Steve into the poster boy for her campaign, while a romance blossoms between Steve and the Ministers Anglo aid, Celia (Lucy Bell). Anyone who is familiar with Nick Giannopoulos’s phenomenally successful stage show ‘Wogs out of work’, will find more of the same ground covered in ‘The Wog boy’ as the film broadly lampoons various Australian stereotypes about first and second generation migrants being a bunch of dole cheating, bludgers. Whether star Giannopoulos, director Aleksi Vellis and co-writer Chris Anastassiades achieve their aim of defusing these racist representations by mocking them will entirely depend on whether you think the old fashioned racial jokes on parade here are actually funny. Cast includes Vince Colosimo, Abi Tucker, Derryn Hinch, John Barresi, Hung Le. Special edition includes behind-the-scenes featurette.

results.title: The Wodaabe
results.creator_credit: Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Disappearing world”.
The Wodaabe are among the world’s last true nomads. They follow their herds in an endless migration across African borders. They have no houses, no huts and no tents. They live and sleep under the skies. Although droughts have ravaged their lands since the 1960’s, anthropologist Mette Bovin sees their life as a balance between hardship and joy. They have an obsession with male beauty and Wodaabe men wear more make-up than Wodaabe women. “We like to see people who are handsome” says one. The Wodaabe insist they will remain nomads despite mounting pressures for them to settle down and lead a “normal” life.

results.title: The Wizard of speed and time
results.creator_credit: Deven Chierighino, Mike Jittlov and Mike Jittlou Productions
results.brief_description: An examination of pixillation technique. From a mountain cave blasts a green wizard, skimming along the highway at incredible speed until slipping on a banana peel. Then from beneath the wreckage of a shattered movie studio, he magically resurrects every piece of equipment and celebrates with song and sparkles.

results.title: The Wizard of Oz. - 50th anniversary ed. (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, Mervyn LeRoy and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The 50th Anniversary Commemorative edition of one of the most popular and successful children’s films ever made. This is a beautifully restored technicolour print with the opening Kansas scenes in warm, sepia tones. Featuring film clips and reconstructed musical numbers cut from the original film, this magical fantasy will entertain adults and children. Based on the book by Frank L. Baum and starring Judy Garland, Ray Bolger and Margaret Hamilton.

results.title: The Wizard of Oz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, Mervyn LeRoy and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This 50th Anniversary Commemorative Edition of the “Wizard of Oz” is as it was originally released in 1939, including the Kansas scenes in warm sepia tones. Featuring film clips and reconstructed musical numbers cut from the original film, this beautifully restored technicolour print is a tribute to the popularity of “The Wizard of Oz” with adults and children alike.

results.title: The Wizard of Oz [1922]
results.brief_description: The classic story of Dorothy who is swept away to the magical land of Oz with her uncle and a couple of hired hands by a cyclone on her 18th birthday. Here they meet weird and wonderful characters and enjoy the adventure of a lifetime. This classic children’s story by L. Frank Baum was adapted for this early silent feature film by the author’s son, five years after his father’s death, along with top Hollywood comedian Larry Semon. Unlike the famous Judy Garland version of the story, there are no witches in Semon’s film, and the Scarecrow, Tin Woodsman and Cowardly Lion are only disguises for other characters to don.

results.title: The Wizard of No
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell, Jon Olinghouse and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: Thirteen-year-old Billy is not the most popular boy in class. The Wizard of No suggests that his lack of popularity is directly related to his inability to say “no”. Points out that the word “no” has both a positive and a negative sense. Follows on with advertising and drug education segments.

results.title: The Wizard from Oz - James Morrison
results.creator_credit: John Ossher, Don Featherstone and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Creative Spirits Series”.
A personal perspective on the life and music of jazz multi-instrumentalist, James Morrison. He heads us through the documentary in a series of statements derived from interviews at a variety of locations - from an empty jazz club in the afternoon, to a studio in New York, seated among some of the finest international jazz musicians of the last fifty years. We encounter his family, his musical colleagues, friends and critics and learn about Jazz and about James Morrison: musician, composer, dare-devil and philosopher, and we listen to his music.
